Name: Linear Programming
Description: Optimization where both the objective function and constraints are linear.
Example: Maximizing profit subject to resource constraints

Name: Integer Programming
Description: Optimization with some or all variables constrained to be integers.

Name: Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Description: Linear programming with some integer variables.
Example: Production planning with fixed machine counts

Name: Quadratic Programming
Description: Optimization with a quadratic objective and linear constraints.

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Optimization where objective or constraints are nonlinear.
Solvability: Depends on problem; may be NP-hard

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: Special case of NLP where objective and feasible set are convex.

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Breaks problem into subproblems and solves recursively.
Example: Shortest path in a weighted graph

Name: Stochastic Programming
Description: Optimization under uncertainty, using probabilistic constraints or objectives.
